member.summary: Encapculates Cuda Stream. Provides interface for async coping. Passed to each function that supports async kernel execution. Reference counting is enabled

member.name: T:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuStereoConstantSpaceBP
member.summary: A Constant-Space Belief Propagation Algorithm for Stereo Matching. Qingxiong Yang, Liang Wang, Narendra Ahuja. http://vision.ai.uiuc.edu/~qyang6/

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuStereoConstantSpaceBP.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A Constant-Space Belief Propagation Algorithm for Stereo Matching
member.param: The number of disparities. Use 128 as default
The number of BP iterations on each level. Use 8 as default.
The number of levels. Use 4 as default
The number of active disparity on the first level. Use 4 as default.

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuStereoConstantSpaceBP.FindStereoCorrespondence(Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuImage{Emgu.CV.Structure.Gray,System.Byte},Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuImage{Emgu.CV.Structure.Gray,System.Byte},Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuImage{Emgu.CV.Structure.Gray,System.Byte},Emgu.CV.GPU.Stream)
member.summary: Computes disparity map for the input rectified stereo pair.
member.param: The left single-channel, 8-bit image
The right image of the same size and the same type
The disparity map
Use a Stream to call the function asynchronously (non-blocking) or null to call the function synchronously (blocking).

member.summary: Release the unmanaged memory

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuHOGDescriptor.#ctor(System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Size,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new HOGDescriptor using the specific parameters
member.param: Block size in cells. Only (2,2) is supported for now.
Cell size. Only (8, 8) is supported for now.
Block stride. Must be a multiple of cell size.
Do gamma correction preprocessing or not.
L2-Hys normalization method shrinkage.
Number of bins. Only 9 bins per cell is supported for now.
Maximum number of detection window increases.
Gaussian smoothing window parameter.
Detection window size. Must be aligned to block size and block stride.

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuHOGDescriptor.GetDefaultPeopleDetector
member.summary: Returns coefficients of the classifier trained for people detection (for default window size).
member.returns: The default people detector

member.summary: Set the SVM detector

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuHOGDescriptor.DetectMultiScale(Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuImage{Emgu.CV.Structure.Bgra,System.Byte},System.Double,System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Size,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perfroms object detection with increasing detection window.
member.param: The GpuImage to search in
The threshold for the distance between features and classifying plane.
Window stride. Must be a multiple of block stride.
Mock parameter to keep CPU interface compatibility. Must be (0,0).
Coefficient of the detection window increase.
After detection some objects could be covered by many rectangles. This coefficient regulates similarity threshold. 0 means don't perform grouping.
member.returns: The regions where positives are found

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuHOGDescriptor.DetectMultiScale(Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuImage{Emgu.CV.Structure.Gray,System.Byte},System.Double,System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Size,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perfroms object detection with increasing detection window.
member.param: The GpuImage to search in
The threshold for the distance between features and classifying plane.
Window stride. Must be a multiple of block stride.
Mock parameter to keep CPU interface compatibility. Must be (0,0).
Coefficient of the detection window increase.
After detection some objects could be covered by many rectangles. This coefficient regulates similarity threshold. 0 means don't perform grouping.
member.returns: The regions where positives are found

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuHOGDescriptor.DetectMultiScale(Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuImage{Emgu.CV.Structure.Bgra,System.Byte})
member.summary: Perfroms object detection with increasing detection window.
member.param: The GpuImage to search in
member.returns: The regions where positives are found

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.LUT(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)

The destination GpuMat

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.Resize(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,Emgu.CV.CvEnum.INTER)
member.summary: Resizes the image. supports CV_8UC1, CV_8UC4 types.
member.param: The source image
The destination image
The interpolation type. Supports INTER_NEAREST, INTER_LINEAR.

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.ConvertTo(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Double,System.Double,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function has several different purposes and thus has several synonyms. It copies one array to another with optional scaling, which is performed first, and/or optional type conversion, performed after: dst(I)=src(I)*scale + (shift,shift,...) All the channels of multi-channel arrays are processed independently. The type conversion is done with rounding and saturation, that is if a result of scaling + conversion can not be represented exactly by a value of destination array element type, it is set to the nearest representable value on the real axis. In case of scale=1, shift=0 no prescaling is done. This is a specially optimized case and it has the appropriate convertTo synonym.
member.param: Source GpuMat
Destination GpuMat
Scale factor
Value added to the scaled source array elements
Use a Stream to call the function asynchronously (non-blocking) or IntPtr.Zero to call the function synchronously (blocking).

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.MinMaxLoc(System.IntPtr,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Drawing.Point@,System.Drawing.Point@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Finds minimum and maximum element values and their positions. The extremums are searched over the whole array or, if mask is not IntPtr.Zero, in the specified array region.
member.param: The source GpuMat, single-channel
Pointer to returned minimum value
Pointer to returned maximum value
Pointer to returned minimum location
Pointer to returned maximum location
The optional mask that is used to select a subarray. Use IntPtr.Zero if not needed

member.summary: Computes mean value and standard deviation
member.param: The GpuMat. Supports only CV_8UC1 type
The mean value
The standard deviation

member.summary: Computes norm of the difference between two arrays

If IntPtr.Zero, norm operation is apply to only. Otherwise, this is the GpuMat of type CV_8UC1
The norm type. Supports NORM_INF, NORM_L1, NORM_L2.
member.returns: The norm of the if is IntPtr.Zero. Otherwise the norm of the difference between two arrays.

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.gpuMatFlip(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Flips the array in one of different 3 ways (row and column indices are 0-based): dst(i,j)=src(rows(src)-i-1,j) if flip_mode = 0 dst(i,j)=src(i,cols(src1)-j-1) if flip_mode > 0 dst(i,j)=src(rows(src)-i-1,cols(src)-j-1) if flip_mode < 0
member.param: Source array.
Destination array.
Specifies how to flip the array. flip_mode = 0 means flipping around x-axis, flip_mode > 0 (e.g. 1) means flipping around y-axis and flip_mode < 0 (e.g. -1) means flipping around both axises.

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.Flip(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,Emgu.CV.CvEnum.FLIP)
member.summary: Flips the GpuMat<Byte> in one of different 3 ways (row and column indices are 0-based).
member.param: Source array.
Destination array.
Specifies how to flip the array.

member.summary: Erodes the image (applies the local minimum operator). Supports CV_8UC1, CV_8UC4 type.

The destination GpuMat
The morphology kernel, pointer to an CvArr
The center of the kernel
The number of iterations morphology is applied

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.BitwiseXor(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Calculates per-element bit-wise logical conjunction of two arrays: dst(I)=src1(I)^src2(I) if mask(I)!=0 In the case of floating-point arrays their bit representations are used for the operation. All the arrays must have the same type, except the mask, and the same size
member.param: The first source array
The second source array
The destination array
Mask, 8-bit single channel array; specifies elements of destination array to be changed. Use IntPtr.Zero if not needed.
Use a Stream to call the function asynchronously (non-blocking) or IntPtr.Zero to call the function synchronously (blocking).

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.BitwiseOr(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Calculates per-element bit-wise logical or of two arrays: dst(I)=src1(I) | src2(I) if mask(I)!=0 In the case of floating-point arrays their bit representations are used for the operation. All the arrays must have the same type, except the mask, and the same size
member.param: The first source array
The second source array
The destination array
Mask, 8-bit single channel array; specifies elements of destination array to be changed. Use IntPtr.Zero if not needed.
Use a Stream to call the function asynchronously (non-blocking) or IntPtr.Zero to call the function synchronously (blocking).

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.BitwiseAnd(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Calculates per-element bit-wise logical and of two arrays: dst(I)=src1(I) & src2(I) if mask(I)!=0 In the case of floating-point arrays their bit representations are used for the operation. All the arrays must have the same type, except the mask, and the same size
member.param: The first source array
The second source array
The destination array
Mask, 8-bit single channel array; specifies elements of destination array to be changed. Use IntPtr.Zero if not needed.
Use a Stream to call the function asynchronously (non-blocking) or IntPtr.Zero to call the function synchronously (blocking).

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.BitwiseNot(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Calculates per-element bit-wise logical not dst(I)=~src(I) if mask(I)!=0 In the case of floating-point arrays their bit representations are used for the operation. All the arrays must have the same type, except the mask, and the same size
member.param: The source array
The destination array
Mask, 8-bit single channel array; specifies elements of destination array to be changed. Use IntPtr.Zero if not needed.
Use a Stream to call the function asynchronously (non-blocking) or IntPtr.Zero to call the function synchronously (blocking).

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.Filter2D(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Applies arbitrary linear filter to the image. In-place operation is supported. When the aperture is partially outside the image, the function interpolates outlier pixel values from the nearest pixels that is inside the image
member.param: The source GpuMat
The destination GpuMmage

Convolution kernel, single-channel floating point matrix (e.g. Emgu.CV.Matrix). If you want to apply different kernels to different channels, split the gpu image into separate color planes and process them individually

The anchor of the kernel that indicates the relative position of a filtered point within the kernel. The anchor shoud lie within the kernel. The special default value (-1,-1) means that it is at the kernel center

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.Sobel(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies generalized Sobel operator to the image
member.param: The source GpuMat
The resulting GpuMat
Order of the derivative x
Order of the derivative y
Size of the extended Sobel kernel
Optional scale, use 1 for default.

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.Laplacian(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies Laplacian operator to the GpuMat
member.param: The source GpuMat
The resulting GpuMat
Either 1 or 3
Optional scale. Use 1.0 for default

member.name: M:Emgu.CV.GPU.GpuInvoke.GaussianBlur(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Size,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Smooths the GpuMat using Gaussian filter.
member.param: The source GpuMat
The smoothed GpuMat
The size of the kernel
This parameter may specify Gaussian sigma (standard deviation). If it is zero, it is calculated from the kernel size.
In case of non-square Gaussian kernel the parameter may be used to specify a different (from param3) sigma in the vertical direction. Use 0 for default
